def: A writer of glosses or comments; a commentator. [R.] "The . . .glossators of Aristotle." Milman.
A silicate of aluminium, occurring usually in thick rhombicprisms, nearly square, of a grayish or pale reddish tint. It wasfirst discovered in Andalusia, Spain.
The doctrine that all the functions of a living organism aredue to an unknown vital principle distinct from all chemical andphysical forces.
Personal property, as distinguished from realty or realproperty.
Any device, as a balloon, aÃ«roplane, etc., for floating in, orflying through, the air.
One of a religious order founded by Ignatius Loyola, andapproved in 1540, under the title of The Society of Jesus.
A mineral consisting, like quartz, of silica, but inferior toquartz in hardness and specific gravity.
The quality or state of being irrelevant; as, the irrelevancyof an argument.
Of the nature of melody; relating to, containing, or made upof, melody; melodious.
A laboring man; a man who earns his daily support by manuallabor.
